item.title: Aamir Khan told Kiran Rao one line from Laapataa Ladies, convincing her: ‘Was struggling as a Laapataa Lady myself’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kiran Rao remembers how she was like a Laapataa Lady before Aamir Khan told her one line from Laapataa Ladies

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Kiran Rao reflects on her journey as a filmmaker, recounting how Aamir Khan inspired her to take on her latest project, Laapataa Ladies, after a long struggle with finding the right story.

  • Laapataa Ladies is Kiran Rao’s second film after Dhobi Ghat, released 13 years prior.
  • The film received critical acclaim and was India’s entry for the Best International Feature Film at the Oscars.
  • Kiran shared that Aamir’s compelling description of the film inspired her to direct it.
  • She expressed enthusiasm about her next project, stating it won’t take another 13 years to announce.
“That one line was just so compelling that I was like, I want to do this, really badly.” - Kiran Rao

Kiran Rao's story showcases the influence of collaboration in filmmaking and her continued commitment to the industry.

item.title: 7 stunning cosmology photos captured by Hubble Space Telescope of NASA - India.com
item.description:
7 Stunning Cosmology Photos from Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: December 21, 2024

Source: India.com

This article showcases breathtaking images captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting various celestial phenomena.

  • Celestial Fireworks:

    DEM L 190, known as LMC N49, is the brightest supernova remnant in the Large Magellanic Cloud, lying around 160,000 light-years from Earth.

  • Einstein Ring:

    GAL-CLUS-022058s is one of the largest and most complete Einstein rings discovered in the universe.

  • Fornax 2:

    A globular cluster in the dwarf galaxy Fornax, showcasing similarities to clusters found in the Milky Way.

  • Star Jets:

    A Herbig-Haro object named HH111 was captured by Hubble's Wide Field Camera 3.

  • Cosmic Discolights:

    An image of the galaxy cluster MACS J0717.5+3745, highlighting dark matter.

  • Dark Matter:

    The galaxy cluster Abell 383 shows the effects of dark matter mass bending light from distant objects.

  • Massive Gamma-ray Burst:

    Observations of gamma-ray burst GRB 190114C, first detected in January 2019.
"These observations from Hubble provide critical insights into the processes occurring in our universe, showcasing the beauty and complexity of cosmic events."

The photos captured by the Hubble Space Telescope not only deepen our understanding of the cosmos but also inspire awe at the wonders of the universe.

item.title: Aston Villa 2-1 Man City (21 Dec, 2024) Game Analysis - ESPN India
item.description:
Aston Villa 2-1 Man City Game Analysis

Publication Date: 21 Dec, 2024 | Source: ESPN (IN)

Aston Villa continued their strong performance in the Premier League with a 2-1 victory over Manchester City, marking City's ninth loss in 12 games across all competitions.

  • Goals from Jhon Durán and Morgan Rogers secured the win for Villa.
  • Villa rose to fifth place in the league, while City dropped to sixth.
  • City's manager, Pep Guardiola, expressed optimism despite the team's struggles.
  • Jhon Durán has now scored in three consecutive matches.
  • Phil Foden scored City's lone goal in stoppage time, but it was not enough.
"We are disappointed, it's not good enough," said City striker Erling Haaland.

This victory showcases Villa’s rise in the league and City’s ongoing challenges in a competitive season.

item.title: Radhika Merchant Shines in a Chic Loro Piana Co-Ord Set At Dhirubhai Ambani School Annual Day - News18
item.description:
Radhika Merchant Shines in a Chic Loro Piana Co-Ord Set At Dhirubhai Ambani School Annual Day

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: News18

Radhika Merchant made a stylish appearance at the Dhirubhai Ambani International School’s annual day celebration, showcasing a blend of luxury and casual elegance.

  • She wore a chambray blue co-ord set from Loro Piana including a button-down shirt priced at ₹1,32,556 and matching trousers priced at ₹1,22,406.
  • Accessories included an Hermès belt, Bolide crossbody bag, and Himalaya Niloticus Crocodile Oran sandals, completing her chic look.
  • The event featured a star-studded guest list with notable personalities like Shah Rukh Khan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, and others.
  • Radhika's minimal yet radiant beauty choices complemented her outfit, showcasing her elegant style.
“With her effortlessly chic co-ord set, Radhika showcased how to perfectly blend casual elegance with luxury.”

This event highlights the intersection of family, style, and celebration in the Ambani household.

item.title: Pushpa 2 The Rule box office collection day 17: Allu Arjun fights fresh allegations even as film mints over ₹1030 crore - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pushpa 2 The Rule box office collection day 17: Allu Arjun fights fresh allegations even as film mints over ₹1030 crore

Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Pushpa 2: The Rule continues to perform exceptionally well at the box office, generating over ₹1030 crore despite fresh allegations against lead actor Allu Arjun regarding a tragic incident at a film screening.

  • The film has grossed approximately ₹25.31 crore net on its third Saturday, totaling ₹1030.21 crore net in 17 days.
  • It earned ₹10.65 crore during its premiere and ₹164.25 crore on opening day.
  • Pushpa 2 broke records to become the highest-grossing film of 2024.
  • Fresh allegations against Allu Arjun stem from a stampede during a film event that resulted in tragic consequences.
  • Telangana CM and MLA have accused him of irresponsibility during the incident.
“According to the information I have received...the film star turned to them, smiled and said, now the film will be a hit.” - MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi

Despite the controversy, Pushpa 2: The Rule's box office numbers indicate strong audience engagement and commercial success.

item.title: Ilness caused by respiratory viruses increases in USA - The Times of India
item.description:
Increased Respiratory Virus Illnesses in the USA

Publication Date: Not Available | Source: CDC Update

The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported a rise in illnesses caused by respiratory viruses, predicting further increases with the flu season approaching.

  • Healthcare visits for respiratory viruses are currently at moderate levels.
  • Hospitalizations are expected to be lower compared to last year.
  • COVID-19 and Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) are significantly affecting the population.
  • Recent data shows that influenza A constitutes nearly 97% of positive flu tests.
  • Louisiana and Oregon are reporting high flu case numbers.
  • Of 1,20,000 hospital admissions since October, 72,000 were COVID-related, with 8,200 deaths.
“If a new variant of COVID does not emerge, the burden in hospitals will lower especially during the holiday season.”

The rise in respiratory illnesses highlights the need for continued vigilance as the flu season intensifies and COVID-19 remains a concern.

Maharashtra portfolio allocation: CM Fadnavis keeps home ministry, Ajit Pawar gets finance, Shinde gets urban development

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Maharashtra government has announced new ministerial portfolios, with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis retaining the home ministry. Ajit Pawar has been assigned finance, while Eknath Shinde will oversee urban development.

  • Devendra Fadnavis retains control over the home ministry.
  • Ajit Pawar has been appointed as the finance minister.
  • Eknath Shinde is now responsible for urban development.
"These allocations are intended to enhance governance and address pressing issues in each department." - Government Spokesperson

This reshuffle aims to strengthen the operational efficiency of the Maharashtra government.

item.description:
Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Devendra Fadnavis keeps home, Eknath Shinde gets urban development

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Maharashtra government has finalized the cabinet portfolios, with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis retaining the pivotal home ministry and Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde receiving urban development.

  • Fadnavis prioritizes the home ministry.
  • Shinde receives urban development and public works.
  • Ajit Pawar will oversee the finance department.
  • Dadaji Bhuse takes over as school education minister.
  • Chandrashekhar Bawankule appointed to the revenue department.
  • Portfolio allocation delayed, leading to speculation of discord within the alliance.
“This session was just a formality,” - Ambadas Danve, Leader of the opposition

This cabinet allocation follows significant electoral success for the BJP-Shiv Sena-NCP alliance in Maharashtra, overcoming prior political drama regarding leadership roles.

item.title: Buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends three stocks to buy on Monday — 23 December 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Sumeet Bagadia's Stock Recommendations for December 23, 2024

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Introduction

Amidst a downturn in the Indian stock market, Sumeet Bagadia, Executive Director at Choice Broking, recommends three stocks to buy to navigate these challenging conditions.

Key Points

  • Indian stock market suffers significant losses with the Nifty 50 index dropping from 23,768 to 23,587.
  • Sumeet Bagadia advises caution as the market may approach a critical support level at 23,250.
  • Recommended stocks for buying: Titan Company, Petronet LNG, and Dr Reddy's Laboratories.

Stock Details

  • Titan Company: Buy at ₹3356.25, target ₹3555, stop loss ₹3222.
  • Petronet LNG: Buy at ₹336.45, target ₹355, stop loss ₹323.
  • Dr Reddy's Laboratories: Buy at ₹1343.65, target ₹1425, stop loss ₹1295.

Notable Quotes

“The overall Indian stock market bias has weakened as the Nifty 50 index has slipped below 200-DEMA support.”

Conclusion

Investors are advised to consider Bagadia's recommendations carefully in light of current market conditions, while also remaining aware of potential risks.

item.title: GST Council Meeting Highlights: GST exemption for micro and small units renting from unregistered individuals under composition scheme - BusinessLine
item.description:
GST Council Meeting Highlights: GST exemption for micro and small units renting from unregistered individuals under composition scheme

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu BusinessLine

The GST Council convened its 55th meeting in Jaisalmer, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, addressing significant tax updates.

  • A 5% GST will be applied to ready-to-eat popcorn with salt and spices, provided it is not pre-packaged.
  • 12% GST is set for pre-packaged popcorn and 18% for caramel popcorn.
  • 5% GST is also recommended for fortified rice kernels, regardless of end use.
  • A proposal to revise GST on insurance was deferred for further deliberation.
  • The Council recommended an increase in GST from 12% to 18% for used electric vehicles (EVs) and smaller petrol/diesel cars.
“If these units have rented their premises from individuals who are unregistered, GST will be exempt for them.” - FM Nirmala Sitharaman

This meeting marks a pivotal step in tax reforms aimed at providing relief to micro and small enterprises while adjusting tax policies on various consumer goods.

item.title: Scientists observe ‘negative time’ in quantum experiments - Macau Business
item.description:
Scientists Discover 'Negative Time' in Quantum Mechanics

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Macau Business

Researchers at the University of Toronto have observed a phenomenon they describe as 'negative time,' shedding light on complex interactions between light and matter.

  • The term ‘negative time’ refers to the duration of excited states in atoms being measured as less than zero.
  • Experiments took over two years to optimize and involved lasers and atoms.
  • The findings challenge conventional understanding but do not imply time travel.
  • The research has garnered both skepticism and intrigue within the scientific community.
“We don’t want to say anything traveled backward in time,” said Aephraim Steinberg, a lead researcher.

The discovery highlights the complexities of quantum mechanics and may pave the way for further exploration of light and time.

item.title: I thought the tri-folding Huawei Mate XT was a gimmick, but then I held it - TechRadar
item.description:
Huawei Mate XT: A Tri-Folding Phone That Surprised Me

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: TechRadar

The Huawei Mate XT is a groundbreaking dual-screen, tri-folding smartphone that has defied initial expectations of being just an expensive gimmick. Its unique design and functionality could redefine the folding phone market.

  • First commercially available tri-folding smartphone.
  • Compact size of 6.4 inches when folded, expands to 10.2 inches fully unfolded.
  • Impressive specifications, including a Kirin 9010 chipset, 16GB RAM, and up to 1TB storage.
  • Strong construction with flexible hinges allowing it to hold positions at various angles.
  • Large battery of 5,600mAh supporting fast charging capabilities.
“Seeing is believing, but feeling is the truth.”

The Mate XT could be a game changer in the foldable market, inspiring future designs from competitors like Samsung. Although currently available only in China, it sets a high standard for foldable technology.

item.description:
PM Modi meets Indian migrant workers at Gulf Spic Labour Camp in Kuwait

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Times of India

Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited the Gulf Spic Labour Camp in Kuwait to meet with Indian migrant workers, emphasizing the government's commitment to their welfare and livelihoods.

  • PM Modi addressed over 8,000 Indian workers at the camp.
  • He acknowledged the challenges faced by migrant workers abroad and assured support from the Indian government.
  • The visit highlighted the importance of diaspora engagement and workers' rights.
“The Indian government will always stand by you,” Modi told the workers, affirming that their contributions are valued.

This visit is part of PM Modi's broader efforts to connect with the Indian diaspora and ensure their well-being while working overseas.

GST Council meet key decisions: No GST on bank penal charges, clarity on tax rate on popcorn & more - top announcements

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The GST Council met to announce key decisions including the exemption of GST on bank penal charges and clarifications on the tax rate for popcorn.

  • No GST applicable on penal charges levied by banks.
  • Clear guidelines on the tax rate for popcorn sold in cinemas.
  • Other changes include adjustments in GST rates for various goods and services.
“These decisions will ease the burden on consumers and provide clarity.” - [Insert Notable Person]

This meeting is poised to influence consumer costs and business operations across sectors affected by these tax clarifications.

item.title: 55th GST council meeting in Jaisalmer on December 21, 2024: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman media briefing - The Hindu
item.description:
55th GST Council Meeting Overview: Key Decisions and Updates

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The 55th meeting of the GST Council, chaired by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, was held on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Several significant discussions on GST changes, including those related to insurance levies, were tabled for future consideration.

  • The review of GST levies on life and health insurance policies was postponed.
  • A Group of Ministers will re-examine the insurance levies prior to making recommendations to the Council.
  • Proposals for rate rationalisation involving about 150 items, such as packaged drinking water and bicycles under ₹10,000, were deferred.
  • The GST on gene therapy and long-range surface to air missiles has been exempted from tax.
  • Used car sales GST increased from 12% to 18%.
  • New tax rates were established for different types of popcorn based on packaging.
  • An examination of GST levies by states hit by natural disasters was initiated.
“Gene therapy that is now critical for dealing with life-threatening diseases, so have been totally exempted [from GST].” - Nirmala Sitharaman

This meeting highlights ongoing efforts to adjust the GST framework to better address various economic needs and situations, while many discussions are still pending for clarity and consensus.

item.title: Christmas market attack suspect was clearly Islamophobic: German minister - The Times of India
item.description:
Christmas Market Attack Suspect Was Clearly Islamophobic: German Minister

Date: Recent Report
Source: Various News Outlets

The German Minister has stated that the suspect in the recent Christmas market attack demonstrated clear Islamophobic motives, raising concerns about hate crimes in the country.

  • The attack occurred at a Christmas market in Germany, causing widespread fear and discussions about security.
  • The suspect's background is being investigated, with a focus on potential radicalization.
  • The minister emphasized the need for stronger measures against hate crimes and discrimination.
“We must be vigilant against the rise of hate in our society,” the minister stated.

This incident highlights the ongoing challenges Germany faces in addressing hate crimes and ensuring the safety of its citizens during public gatherings.

item.title: Multistorey building collapses in Punjab’s Mohali, several feared trapped - The Hindu
item.description:
Multistorey Building Collapse in Mohali Leaving Several Trapped

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: PTI

Rescue operations are ongoing after a multistorey building collapsed in Sohana village, Mohali, with fears that people are trapped beneath the debris.

  • The incident occurred on December 21, 2024, according to local sources.
  • District authorities have initiated rescue operations, employing two excavators and a National Disaster Response Team (NDRF) has been dispatched to the site.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expressed concern and confirmed that rescue efforts are ongoing, urging cooperation from the public.
  • Preliminary reports suggest the building may have collapsed after excavation work was done nearby.
  • Senior police officials are monitoring the rescue operations, emphasizing the urgency of clearing the debris.
“It is an unfortunate incident. Rescue operation is in full swing.” - Kulwant Singh, Mohali MLA

The situation remains critical as authorities work tirelessly to locate and rescue those potentially trapped under the rubble.

item.title: When PM Modi Fulfilled A Special Request From 101-Year-Old IFS Officer’s Kin In Kuwait - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old IFS Officer in Heartwarming Gesture

Date: December 22, 2024   Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi's fulfilling a family request to meet 101-year-old Indian Foreign Service officer, Mangal Sain Handa, in Kuwait has captured hearts.

  • An emotional meeting took place after a request via social media from Handa's granddaughter.
  • Handa, who has an extensive career in foreign service across multiple countries, expressed admiration for PM Modi.
  • The prime minister promised to meet Handa during his visit to interact with the Indian diaspora.
  • The event highlighted Modi’s connection with ordinary citizens through social media.
“You’ve won our hearts once again…Mangal Sain Handa is overjoyed, and his smile means the world to us.” - Shreya Juneja

This memorable interaction underscores the importance of personal connections in leadership, reinforcing PM Modi's relationship with the public.

item.title: Pushpa 2 box office day 17 early report: Allu Arjun-starrer just Rs 10 cr away from crossing Baahubali 2’s domestic record, inches away from Rs 1030 cr - The Indian Express
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 17 Early Report: Allu Arjun-Starrer Just Rs 10 Cr Away from Crossing Baahubali 2’s Domestic Record

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Pushpa 2: The Rule continues to break box office records as it inches closer to overtaking Baahubali 2’s domestic gross. The film has now crossed the Rs 1000 crore mark in India.

  • Pushpa 2 has earned Rs 14.36 crore on its 17th day, with expectations to cross Rs 20 crore over the weekend.
  • The film achieved a total collection of Rs 1020 crore in India till Saturday evening.
  • Pushpa 2 made Rs 264.8 crore in its second week, a 63% drop from its first week.
  • Baahubali 2’s record stands at Rs 1030.42 crore domestically, which Pushpa 2 is projected to surpass soon.
  • The film has a strong occupancy rate of 29.97% for Telugu and 23.6% for Hindi audiences on Day 17.
  • Pushpa 2 has also crossed Rs 1500 crore worldwide within its first 16 days.
“It looks like Pushpa 2 will cross that record soon.”

As the film continues to perform incredibly, its box office journey will be closely monitored, especially with new releases on the horizon.

item.title: Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A multi-storey building in Mohali collapsed, with several people feared trapped under the debris. Emergency services are currently engaged in rescue operations.

  • A multi-storey building collapsed in Mohali, Punjab.
  • District authorities have launched a rescue operation with two excavators and a fire brigade present.
  • A loud noise was reported at the time of the collapse.
  • Causal factors are being investigated, particularly concerning basement excavation nearby.
  • Police and NDRF teams are on-site, and efforts are underway to rescue the trapped individuals.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is coordinating with the administration and the rescue teams.
“We pray that there is no loss of life, we will also take action against the culprits.” - Bhagwant Mann

The incident has raised concerns about safety protocols in construction and ongoing rescue efforts are crucial for those potentially trapped.

item.description:
Watch: Australian Media Baffled Over Ravindra Jadeja's Alleged Refusal To Answer Queries In English

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: News18

A Border-Gavaskar Trophy Down Under is incomplete without controversies, and the ongoing series has been no different. Australian media reported that Ravindra Jadeja did not answer questions in English during a press conference at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, causing confusion among local journalists.

  • Jadeja addressed a press conference but spoke only in Hindi.
  • A video of him discussing a previous match in Brisbane went viral.
  • The Australian media expressed bewilderment at his refusal to respond in English.
  • India's media manager had a confrontation with local reporters, stating they needed to leave.
  • This event follows another controversy involving Virat Kohli and an Australian journalist.
BREAKING🚨The Australian media has unnecessarily targeted the Indian cricket team once again.

The controversy highlights ongoing tensions between Indian players and Australian media. Despite the confusion, the India-Australia match series remains tightly contested.

item.title: Poll Rules Tweak Makes Electronic Records Harder To Get, Sparks Row - NDTV
item.description:
Poll Rules Tweak Makes Electronic Records Harder To Get, Sparks Row

Publication Date: Recent

Source: NDTV

The government has amended election rules to limit public access to certain electronic records, which has raised concerns about transparency in the electoral process.

  • The amendment prevents public inspection of electronic records like CCTV footage and webcasting from polling stations.
  • Officials argue the change is necessary to prevent misuse and protect voter secrecy.
  • Opposition parties claim the amendment erodes the integrity of the electoral process.
  • A court case prompted the amendment, emphasizing the need for clarity regarding what documents are available for public inspection.
  • The amendment only allows access to documents explicitly mentioned in election rules.
“If there was ever a vindication of our assertions regarding the rapidly eroding integrity of the electoral process managed by the Election Commission of India (ECI) in recent times, this is it.” - Jairam Ramesh

This amendment has sparked considerable debate about the balance between election security and public transparency.
